page.title: 14COMMUNITY HALLS DOWNDERRY
page.content: THE VILLAGE HAS THREE HALLS.TWO OF THESE ARE OWNED AND MANAGED BY THE CHURCHES,THE THIRD IS RUN BY AN ELECTED COMMITTEE OF MEMBERS.THE ANGLICAN HALL {CHURCH ROOMS}IS SMALL. IT IS THE VENUE OF MANY GROUPS INCLUDING THE WEDNESDAY CLUB (=Senior Citizens),BROWNIES,CUBS,SCOUTS,GUIDES & WOMEN'S INSTITUTE.ON THREE MORNINGS EACH WEEK A PLAYSCHOOL OR TODDLERS GROUP MEET THERE.OCCASIONAL ADULT EDUCATION CLASSES IN A VARIETY OF SUBJECTS FROM PAINTING,DRESS MAKING TO UPHOLSTERY ARE ALSO HELD.THE SCHOOL FACILITIES ARE RARELY AVAILABLE FOR OUTSIDE USERS BUT THE PARENT/TEACHERS GROUP RUN JUMBLE SALES AND THE ANNUAL VILLAGE SPORTS IS HELD ON THE SCHOOL FIELD.THE CHAPEL HALL IS VERY SMALL AND USED AS A VENUE FOR THE RANGERS AND THE SUNDAY SCHOOL.THE RECENTLY DEFUNCT YOUTH CLUB MET THERE.
